channel.title: Chats with James Podcast
channel.description:
Chats with James is a podcast discussing everything that James or his guests are passionate about.
Embedded Systems, the Rust Programming Language, and a variety of other technical topics are the most commonly discussed items.
New episodes are released every Tuesday.
channel.itunes:author: James Munns
channel.itunes:subtitle: James Munns talks to guests about things they are passionate about
channel.itunes:summary:
Chats with James is a podcast discussing everything that James or his guests are passionate about.
Embedded Systems, the Rust Programming Language, and a variety of other technical topics are the most commonly discussed items.
New episodes are released every Tuesday.

item.title: 010 - Dion Doktor
item.description: James chats with Dion Doktor about device drivers, bootloaders, and embedded Rust.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Dion Doktor
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Dion Doktor about device drivers, bootloaders, and embedded Rust.

item.title: 009 - Sylvan Morris
item.description: James chats with Sylvan Morris about introducing Rust into a company, working at an embedded startup, over the air bootloaders, and managing risk.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Sylvan Morris
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Sylvan Morris about introducing Rust into a company, working at an embedded startup, over the air bootloaders, and managing risk.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, Rust, risk, start-ups, embedded

item.title: 008 - Yoshua Wuyts
item.description: James chats with Yoshua Wuyts to discuss Control Theory in traditional software domains, the possibilities of RISC-V, and open source hardware.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Yoshua Wuyts
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Yoshua Wuyts to discuss Control Theory in traditional software domains, the possibilities of RISC-V, and open source hardware.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, Rust, control systems, risc-v

item.title: 007 - Michael Nitschinger
item.description: James chats with Michael Nitschinger of Couchbase to discuss Coffee Machines, PID control loops, Bluetooth Low Energy, and Databases.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Michael Nitschinger of Couchbase
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Michael Nitschinger of Couchbase to discuss Coffee Machines, PID control loops, Bluetooth Low Energy, and Databases.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, Rust, coffee, espresso, control systems, databases

item.title: 006 - Bryan Cantrill
item.description: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer to discuss the open source hardware explosion, Oxide's experience with Embedded Rust, the importance of a culture of sharing knowledge, and the joy of fixing hard-to-diagnose systems problems.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer Company
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer to discuss the open source hardware explosion, Oxide's experience with Embedded Rust, the importance of a culture of sharing knowledge, and the joy of fixing hard-to-diagnose systems problems.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, Rust, systems engineering, open source

item.title: 005 - Clifford Heath
item.description: James chats with Clifford Heath to discuss the differences between procedural and structural code, using natural language processing to describe software, code generation, and programming education approaches.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Clifford Heath
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Clifford Heath to discuss the differences between procedural and structural code, using natural language processing to describe software, code generation, and programming education approaches.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, schemas, natural language

item.title: 004 - François Baldassari
item.description: James chats with François Baldassari to discuss embedded systems, engineering practices (and where the industry is lacking), and the social side of improving the skills of embedded systems teams.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with François Baldassari of Memfault
item.itunes:summary: James chats with François Baldassari to discuss embedded systems, engineering practices (and where the industry is lacking), and the social side of improving the skills of embedded systems teams.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, embedded, embedded systems, software quality, engineering

item.description: James chats with Michael Gattozzi to discuss developer tooling, message serialization, and undefined behavior in Rust.
